quote0.quote: The best way to end a war is not to begin it.
quote0.author: Source Unknown

quote1.quote: Two things rob people of their peace of mind : work unfinished and work not yet begun.
quote1.author: Source Unknown

quote2.quote: Peace is the deliberate adjustment of my life to the will of God.
quote2.author: Source Unknown

quote3.quote: Peace is that brief glorious moment in history when everybody stands around reloading.
quote3.author: Source Unknown

quote4.quote: Maintain peace with men, war with their vices.
quote4.author: Source Unknown

quote5.quote: A peace that depends on fear is nothing but a suppressed war.
quote5.author: Henry Van Dyke

quote6.quote: Observe good faith and justice toward all nations. Cultivate peace and harmony with all.
quote6.author: George Washington

quote7.quote: To be prepared for war is one of the most effective means of preserving peace.
quote7.author: George Washington

quote8.quote: Peace hath higher tests of manhood than battle ever knew.
quote8.author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote9.quote: Mankind must remember that peace is not God's gift to his creatures; peace is our gift to each other.
quote9.author: Elie Wiesel, Nobel lecture, Oslo, December 11, 1986

quote10.quote: They imply, first of all, that it must be a peace without victory. It is not pleasant to say this. I beg that I may be permitted to put my own interpretation upon it and that it may be understood that no other interpretation was in my thought. I am seeking only to face realities and to face them without soft concealments. Victory would mean peace forced upon the loser, a victor's terms imposed upon the vanquished. It would be accepted in humiliation, under duress, at an intolerable sacrifice, and would leave a sting, a resentment, a bitter memory upon which terms of peace would rest, not permanently, but only as upon quicksand. Only a peace between equals can last, only a peace the very principle of which is equality and a common participation in a common benefit. The right state of mind, the right feeling between nations, is as necessary for a lasting peace as is the just settlement of vexed questions of territory or of racial and national allegiance.
quote10.author: Woodrow Wilson, Address of the President of the United States to the Senate, January 22, 1917

quote11.quote: There is a price which is too great to pay for peace, and that price can be put in one word. One cannot pay the price of self-respect.
quote11.author: Woodrow Wilson

quote12.quote: We can best help you to prevent war not by repeating your words and following your methods but by finding new words and creating new methods.
quote12.author: Virginia Woolf

quote13.quote: War can only be abolished through war, and in order to get rid of the gun it is necessary to take up the gun.
quote13.author: Mao Zedong

quote14.quote: We used to wonder where war lived, what it was that made it so vile. And now we realize that we know where it lives, that it is inside ourselves.
quote14.author: Albert Camus

quote15.quote: This is the greatest honour I have ever received in my life. Peace has always been my greatest concern. Yet in my childhood I learned to love it. My mother - an exceptional, brilliant woman - used to speak to me about it when I was still a child, because in those years there were also a lot of wars. Moreover, I am Catalan. Catalonia had the first democratic Parliament much before than England. And it was in my country where there was a beginning of united nations. At that time - the eleventh Century - they met in Toluges - today in France - to speak about peace, because the Catalonian people of that time were already against war. That is why, the United Nations, which work only for the ideal of peace, are in my hearth, because everything relating to peace goes directly there.I have not played the cello in front of an audience since long years but I think I must do it this time. I am going to play a melody from the Catalonian folklore: The singing of the Birds. Birds, when in the sky, go singing: Peace, peace, peace. And this is a melody that Bach, Beethoven and all great people would have admired and loved. And, in addition, it springs up from the soul of my country: Catalonia.
quote15.author: Pau (Pablo) Casals, Before the United Nations Assembly accepting the Medal of Peace

quote16.quote: When the soul is naughted and transformed, then of herself she neither works nor speaks nor wills, nor feels nor hears nor understands; neither has she of herself the feeling of outward or inward, where she may move. And in all things it is God who rules and guides her, without the meditation of any creature.... And she is so full of peace that thought she pressed her flesh, her nerves, her bones, no other thing come forth from them than peace.
quote16.author: St. Catherine of Genoa

quote17.quote: There is no shadow of protection to be had by sheltering behind the slender stockades of visionary speculation, or by hiding behind the wagon-wheels of pacific theories.
quote17.author: Madame Chiang Kai-Shek

quote18.quote: I prefer the most unfair peace to the most righteous war.
quote18.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote19.quote: The United States is not a nation to which peace is a necessity.
quote19.author: Grover Cleveland

quote20.quote: What all men are really after is some form, or perhaps only some formula, of peace.
quote20.author: Joseph Conrad

quote22.quote: If you want to make peace, you don't talk to your friends. You talk to your enemies.
quote22.author: Moshe Dayan

quote23.quote: That doctrine of peace at any price has done more mischief than any I can well recall that have been afloat in this country. It has occasioned more wars than any of the most ruthless conquerors. It has disturbed and nearly destroyed that political equilibrium so necessary to the liberties and the welfare of the world.
quote23.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote24.quote: There hasn't been peace on earth because people cant seem to figure out that the real enemy is the people manipulating world events from behind the scenes for their own selfish interests.
quote24.author: James Dye

quote25.quote: Every kind of peaceful cooperation among men is primarily based on mutual trust and only secondarily on institutions such as courts of justice and police.
quote25.author: Albert Einstein

quote26.quote: For peace of mind, we need to resign as general manager of the universe.
quote26.author: Larry Eisenberg

quote27.quote: We seek peace, knowing that peace is the climate of freedom.
quote27.author: Dwight D Eisenhower

quote28.quote: Peace and justice are two sides of the same coin.
quote28.author: Dwight D Eisenhower

quote29.quote: Though force can protect in emergency, only justice, fairness, consideration and cooperation can finally lead men to the dawn of eternal peace.
quote29.author: Dwight D Eisenhower

quote30.quote: We have heard much of the phrase, peace and friendship. This phrase, in expressing the aspiration of America, is not complete. We should say instead, peace and friendship, in freedom. This, I think, is America's real message to the rest of the world.
quote30.author: Dwight D Eisenhower

quote31.quote: Think not forever of yourselves, O Chiefs, nor of your own generation. Think of continuing generations of our families, think of our grandchildren and of those yet unborn, whose faces are coming from beneath the ground.
quote31.author: TS (Thomas Stearns) Eliot

quote32.quote: Peace cannot be achieved through violence, it can only be attained through understanding.
quote32.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote33.quote: Peace has its victories, but it takes brave men and women to win them.
quote33.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote34.quote: Nothing can bring you peace but yourself; nothing, but the triumph of principles.
quote34.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote35.quote: All men love peace in their armchairs after dinner; but they disbelieve the other nations's professions, rightly measuring its sincerity by their own.
quote35.author: Oscar W. FirkinsOscar Firkins: Memoirs and Letters

quote36.quote: There never was a good war or a bad peace.
quote36.author: Benjamin Franklin

quote37.quote: He that would live in peace and at ease must not speak all he knows or all he sees.
quote37.author: Benjamin Franklin

quote38.quote: If we are to live together in peace, we must come to know each other better.
quote38.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote39.quote: I do not want the peace which passeth understanding, I want the understanding which bringeth peace.
quote39.author: Helen Keller

quote40.quote: Peace and happiness are what you covet, but these are only to be obtained by labor.
quote40.author: Thomas Kempis

quote41.quote: Do not let your peace depend on the hearts of men; whatever they say about you, good or bad, you are not because of it another man, for as you are, you are.
quote41.author: Thomas Kempis

quote42.quote: First keep peace with yourself, then you can also bring peace to others.
quote42.author: Thomas Kempis

quote43.quote: But peace does not rest in the charters and covenants alone. It lies in the hearts and minds of all people. So let us not rest all our hopes on parchment and on paper, let us strive to build peace, a desire for peace, a willingness to work for peace in the hearts and minds of all of our people. I believe that we can. I believe the problems of human destiny are not beyond the reach of human beings.
quote43.author: John Fitzgerald Kennedy

quote44.quote: It is an unfortunate fact that we can secure peace only by preparing for war.
quote44.author: John Fitzgerald Kennedy

quote45.quote: Peace is a daily, a weekly, a monthly process, gradually changing opinions, slowly eroding old barriers, quietly building new structures.
quote45.author: John Fitzgerald Kennedy

quote46.quote: World peace, like community peace, does not require that each man love his neighbor -- it requires only that they live together with mutual tolerance, submitting their disputes to a just and peaceful settlement.
quote46.author: John Fitzgerald Kennedy

quote47.quote: You can't have a better tomorrow if you are thinking about yesterday all the time.
quote47.author: Charles Franklin Kettering

quote48.quote: Peace is not merely a distant goal that we seek, but a means by which we arrive at that goal.
quote48.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote49.quote: Please, we can get along here.
quote49.author: Rodney King

quote50.quote: Yes, we are all different. Different customs, different foods, different mannerisms, different languages, but not so different that we cannot get along with one another. If we will disagree without being disagreeable.
quote50.author: J. Martin Kohe

quote51.quote: Live and let live is the rule of common justice.
quote51.author: Sir Roger L'Estrange

quote52.quote: But then peace, peace! I am so mistrustful of it: so much afraid that it means a sort of weakness and giving in.
quote52.author: D. H. (David Herbert) LawrenceSelected Letters of D. H. Lawrence

quote53.quote: You either get tired fighting for peace, or you die.
quote53.author: John Lennon

quote54.quote: Imagine all the people living life in peace. You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us, and the world will be as one.
quote54.author: John Lennon

quote55.quote: It just was a gradual development over the years. I mean last year was 'all you need is Love.' This year, it's 'all you need is Love and peace, baby.' Give peace a chance, and remember Love. The only hope for us is peace. Violence begets violence. You can have peace as soon as you like if we all pull together. You're all geniuses, and you're all beautiful. You don't need anyone to tell you who you are. You are what you are. Get out there and get peace, think peace, and live peace and breathe peace, and you'll get it as soon as you like.
quote55.author: John Lennon

quote56.quote: Force is all-conquering, but its victories are short-lived.
quote56.author: Abraham Lincoln

quote57.quote: I heard the bells on Christmas Day. Their old familiar carols play. And wild and sweet the words repeat. Of peace on earth goodwill to men.
quote57.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote58.quote: If man does find the solution for world peace it will be the most revolutionary reversal of his record we have ever known.
quote58.author: General George Catlett MarshallBiennial Report of the Chief of Staff, US Army, September 1, 1945

quote59.quote: A musician must make music, an artist must paint, a poet must write, if they are to be ultimately at peace with themselves.
quote59.author: Abraham Maslow

quote60.quote: Let us ever remember that our interest is in concord, not in conflict; and that our real eminence rests in the victories of peace, not those of war.
quote60.author: William McKinley

quote61.quote: Let the ideas clash but not the hearts.
quote61.author: C. C. Mehta

quote62.quote: The pacifist is as surely a traitor to his country and to humanity as is the most brutal wrongdoer.
quote62.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote63.quote: Peace is normally a great good, and normally it coincides with righteousness, but it is righteousness and not peace which should bind the conscience of a nation as it should bind the conscience of an individual; and neither a nation nor an individual can surrender conscience to another's keeping.
quote63.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote64.quote: You may either win your peace or buy it: win it, by resistance to evil; buy it, by compromise with evil.
quote64.author: John Ruskin

quote65.quote: This idea of weapons of mass exterminations utterly horrible and is something which no one with one spark of humanity can tolerate. I will not pretend to obey a government which is organizing a mass massacre of mankind.
quote65.author: Bertrand Russell

quote66.quote: Peace is more precious than a piece of land.
quote66.author: Anwar Sadat

quote67.quote: O Lord, make me an instrument of Thy Peace! Where there is hatred, let me sow love.Where there is injury, pardon.Where there is discord, harmony.Where there is doubt, faith.Where there is despair, hope.Where there is darkness, light.Where there is sorrow, joy.Oh Divine Master, grant that I may not so much seek to be consoled as to console; to be understood as to understand; to be loved as to love; for it is in giving that we receive; it is in pardoning that we are pardoned; and it is in dying that we are born to Eternal Life.The exact origin of this beautiful prayer remains unknown, it does not appear in any known writings of St Francis. The first known appearance of this inspiring prayer was in 1912 when it was published in the French magazine La Clochette.http://wahiduddin.net/saint_francis_of_assisi.htm
quote67.author: Saint Francis of AssisiThe Peace Prayer of Saint Francis (often referred to as The Prayer of Saint Francis of Assisi)

quote68.quote: Sometime they'll give a war and nobody will come.
quote68.author: Carl Sandburg

quote69.quote: Peace is rarely denied to the peaceful.
quote69.author: Friedrich von Schiller

quote70.quote: It is difficult for intellect, technology, and peace to coexist. Not because peace is static where the other two require constant stimulation. Peace can embrace change. It is because we live in a world where intellect and technology compete for power. And peace does not allow for inequality or competition.
quote70.author: Andrea Scholer

quote71.quote: When the wish for peace is genuine, the means for finding it is giving in a form each mind that seeks for it in honesty can understand.
quote71.author: Helen Schucman

quote72.quote: A peace above all earthly dignities, a still and quiet conscience.
quote72.author: William Shakespeare

quote73.quote: Peace is not only better than war, but infinitely more arduous
quote73.author: George Bernard Shaw

quote74.quote: I will not play at tug o' war.I'd rather play at hug o' war,Where everyone hugsInstead of tugs,Where everyone gigglesAnd rolls on the rug,Where everyone kisses,And everyone grins,And everyone cuddles,And everyone wins.
quote74.author: Shel SilversteinHug O' War

quote75.quote: The wise man... if he would live at peace with others, he will bear and forbear.
quote75.author: Samuel Smiles

quote76.quote: Peace is not an absence of war, it is a virtue, a state of mind, a disposition for benevolence, confidence, justice.
quote76.author: Baruch (_Benedict de) Spinoza

quote77.quote: To many men... the miasma of peace seems more suffocating than the bracing air of war.
quote77.author: George Steiner

quote78.quote: Peace is the one condition of survival in this nuclear age.
quote78.author: Adlai Stevenson

quote79.quote: They make a wilderness and call it peace.
quote79.author: Tacitus

quote80.quote: Wars begin in the minds of men, and in those minds, love and compassion would have built the defenses of peace.
quote80.author: U. Thant

quote81.quote: Let us not be justices of the peace, but angels of peace.
quote81.author: St. Theresa of Lisieux

quote82.quote: Peace is the happy natural state of man; war is corruption and disgrace.
quote82.author: James Thomson

quote83.quote: I would rather have peace in the world than be President.
quote83.author: Harry S Truman

quote84.quote: It is understanding that gives us an ability to have peace. When we understand the other fellow's viewpoint, and he understands ours, then we can sit down and work out our differences.
quote84.author: Harry S Truman

quote85.quote: Peace may cost as much as war, but it is a better buy.
quote85.author: Source Unknown

quote86.quote: When we can't find peace in ourselves it is vain to look for it elsewhere.
quote86.author: Proverb

quote87.quote: Nonviolence is the supreme law of life.
quote87.author: Proverb

quote88.quote: Peace with a club in hand is war.
quote88.author: Proverb

quote89.quote: If a man would live in peace he should be blind, deaf, and dumb.
quote89.author: Proverb

quote90.quote: Harmony is one phase of the law whose spiritual expression is love.
quote90.author: James Allen

quote91.quote: Bullets cannot be recalled. They cannot be uninvented. But they can be taken out of the gun.
quote91.author: Martin Amis

quote92.quote: Right human relations is the only true peace.
quote92.author: Alice A. Bailey

quote93.quote: If the history of the past fifty years teaches us anything, it is that peace does not follow disarmament -- disarmament follows peace.
quote93.author: Bernard Baruch

quote94.quote: They shall beat their swords into plowshares, and their spears into pruning-hooks: nation shall not lift up sword against nation, neither shall they learn war any more. Isaiah 2:4
quote94.author: Bible

quote95.quote: Seek peace, and pursue it. Proverbs 34:14
quote95.author: Bible

quote96.quote: The peace makers shall be called the children of God.
quote96.author: Bible

quote97.quote: Think not I came to send peace on the earth; I came not to send peace but a sword.
quote97.author: Bible

quote98.quote: Those who love thy law have great peace, and nothing causes them to stumble. Psalms 119:165
quote98.author: Bible

quote99.quote: When a person's ways please the Lord, he makes even his enemies to be at peace with them.
quote99.author: Bible

quote100.quote: Peace, in international affairs, is a period of cheating between two periods of fighting.
quote100.author: Ambrose Bierce

quote101.quote: If they want peace, nations should avoid the pin-pricks that precede cannon-shots.
quote101.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote102.quote: One cannot subdue a man by holding back his hands. Lasting peace comes not from force.
quote102.author: David Borenstein, October 26, 1999

quote103.quote: When you're finally up on the moon, looking back at the earth, all these differences and nationalistic traits are pretty well going to blend and you're going to get a concept that maybe this is really one world and why the hell can't we learn to live together like decent people?
quote103.author: Frank Borman

quote104.quote: We've learned how to destroy, but not to create; how to waste, but not to build; how to kill men, but not how to save them; how to die, but seldom how to live.
quote104.author: Omar Bradley

quote105.quote: In truth, to attain to interior peace, one must be willing to pass through the contrary to peace. Such is the teaching of the Sages.
quote105.author: Swami Brahmanada

quote106.quote: Don't tell me peace has broken out.
quote106.author: Bertolt Brecht

quote107.quote: All that a pacifist can undertake -- but it is a very great deal -- is to refuse to kill, injure or otherwise cause suffering to another human creature, and untiringly to order his life by the rule of love though others may be captured by hate.
quote107.author: Vera Brittain

quote108.quote: Why can't peace be a single overriding common purpose: why do we wait for a crisis to pull us together? Let's pull together for peace.
quote108.author: Rita Mae Brown

quote109.quote: 'He insulted me, he cheated me, he beat me, he robbed me' -- those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace.
quote109.author: Buddha

quote110.quote: It is madness for sheep to talk peace with a wolf.
quote110.author: Thomas Fuller

quote111.quote: You cannot shake hands with a clenched fist.
quote111.author: Indira GandhiQuoted by Christian Science Monitor, May 17, 1982

quote112.quote: Mental violence has no potency and injures only the person whose thoughts are violent. It is otherwise with mental non-violence. It has potency which the world does not yet know.
quote112.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote113.quote: A peace that comes from fear and not from the heart is the opposite of peace.
quote113.author: Gersonides

quote114.quote: It is easier to lead men to combat, stirring up their passion, than to restrain them and direct them toward the patient labors of peace.
quote114.author: Andre Gide

quote115.quote: We look forward to the time when the Power of Love will replace the Love of Power. Then will our world know the blessings of Peace.
quote115.author: William Ewart Gladstone

quote116.quote: Never for the sake of peace and quiet deny your convictions.
quote116.author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote117.quote: The pursuit of peace and progress cannot end in a few years in either victory or defeat. The pursuit of peace and progress, with its trials and its errors, its successes and its setbacks, can never be relaxed and never abandoned.
quote117.author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote118.quote: The practice of peace and reconciliation is one of the most vital and artistic of human actions.
quote118.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote119.quote: I now understand what Christ suffered in Gethsemane as well as any man living.
quote119.author: James Keir Hardie

quote120.quote: If mankind had wished for what is right, they might have had it long ago.
quote120.author: William Hazlitt

quote121.quote: In moderating, not satisfying desires, lies peace.
quote121.author: Ben Hecht

quote122.quote: One sword keeps another in the sheath.
quote122.author: George Herbert

quote123.quote: War grows out of the desire of the individual to gain advantage at the expense of his fellow men.
quote123.author: Napoleon Hill

quote124.quote: Yes, we love peace, but we are not willing to take wounds for it, as we are for war.
quote124.author: John Andrew HolmesWisdom in Small Doses

quote125.quote: Peace is not made at the council table or by treaties, but in the hearts of men.
quote125.author: Herbert Hoover

quote126.quote: Universal peace sounds ridiculous to the head of an average family.
quote126.author: Kin Hubbard

quote127.quote: Peace has its victories no less than war, but it doesn't have as many monuments to unveil.
quote127.author: Kin Hubbard

quote128.quote: The pursuit of peace resembles the building of a great cathedral. It is the work of a generation. In concept it requires a master-architect; in execution, the labors of many.
quote128.author: Hubert Humphrey

quote129.quote: It is useless for the sheep to pass resolutions in favor of vegetarianism, while the wolf remains of a different opinion.
quote129.author: W. R. [William Ralph] Inge

quote130.quote: Peace and friendship with all mankind is our wisest policy, and I wish we may be permitted to pursue it.
quote130.author: Thomas Jefferson

quote131.quote: There is peace more destructive of the manhood of living man than war is destructive of his material body.
quote131.author: Douglas William Jerrold

quote132.quote: Not peace at any price! Chains are worse than bayonets.
quote132.author: Douglas William Jerrold

quote133.quote: To get Peace you must work for Justice.
quote133.author: John Paul VI

quote134.quote: Peace has her victories which are no less renowned than war.
quote134.author: John Milton

quote135.quote: War is pillage versus resistance and if illusions of magnitude could be transmuted into ideals of magnanimity, peace might be realized.
quote135.author: Marianne Moore

quote136.quote: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
quote136.author: Mother Theresa

quote137.quote: Everybody today seems to be in such a terrible rush, anxious for greater developments and greater riches and so on, so that children have very little time for their parents. Parents have very little time for each other, and in the home begins the disruption of peace of the world.
quote137.author: Mother Theresa

quote138.quote: If the Nazis have really been guilty of the unspeakable crimes circumstantially imputed to them, then -- let us make no mistake -- pacifism is faced with a situation with which it cannot cope. The conventional pacifist conception of a reasonable or generous peace is irrelevant to this reality.
quote138.author: John Middleton Murry

quote139.quote: There is no way to peace; peace is the way.
quote139.author: A. J. Muste

quote140.quote: Peace is not a relationship of nations. It is a condition of mind brought about by a serenity of soul. Peace is not merely the absence of war. It is also a state of mind. Lasting peace can come only to peaceful people.
quote140.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote141.quote: The man who has gotten everything he wants is all in favor of peace and order.
quote141.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote142.quote: What we need is a generation of peace.
quote142.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote143.quote: Peace is no more than a dream as long as we need the comfort of the clan.
quote143.author: Peter Nicols

quote144.quote: The greatest honor history can bestow is that of peacemaker.
quote144.author: Richard Milhous Nixon

quote145.quote: Violence is unnecessary and costly. Peace is the only way.
quote145.author: Julius Kambarge Nyerere

quote146.quote: The world cannot continue to wage war like physical giants and to seek peace like intellectual pygmies.
quote146.author: Basil O'Connor

quote147.quote: When you find peace within yourself, you become the kind of person who can live at peace with others.
quote147.author: Peace Pilgrim

quote148.quote: No one can find inner peace except by working, not in a self- centered way, but for the whole human family.
quote148.author: Peace Pilgrim

quote149.quote: World peace will never be stable until enough of us find inner peace to stabilize it
quote149.author: Peace Pilgrim

quote150.quote: We can work on inner peace and world peace at the same time. On one hand, people have found inner peace by losing themselves in a cause larger than themselves, like the cause of world peace, because finding inner peace means coming from the self-centered life into the life centered in the good of the whole. On the other hand, one of the ways of working for world peace is to work for more inner peace, because world peace will never be stable until enough of us find inner peace to stabilize it.
quote150.author: Peace Pilgrim

quote151.quote: This is the way of peace: Overcome evil with good, falsehood with truth, and hatred with love.
quote151.author: Peace Pilgrim

quote152.quote: One little person, giving all of her time to peace, makes news. Many people, giving some of their time, can make history.
quote152.author: Peace Pilgrim

quote153.quote: The true and solid peace of nations consists not in equality of arms, but in mutual trust alone.
quote153.author: Pope John XXIII

quote154.quote: If you want peace work for justice.
quote154.author: Pope Paul VI

quote156.quote: When we are unable to find tranquility within ourselves, it is useless to seek it elsewhere.
quote156.author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quote157.quote: If we want a free and peaceful world, if we want to make the deserts bloom and man grow to greater dignity as a human being-we can do it.
quote157.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
